### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Methylphenidate is the first-line treatment for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), as supported by clinical guidelines. It is a central nervous system stimulant that effectively increases attention span and reduces impulsivity in patients with ADHD. Other options, such as Haloperidol (an antipsychotic), Imipramine (a tricyclic antidepressant), and Alprazolam (a benzodiazepine), are not indicated for the treatment of ADHD and are not considered first-line therapies. Methylphenidate is FDA-approved for ADHD and is widely prescribed, confirming its status as the drug of choice.
